si.t: Initial version - goal to calculate run time based on % of SWG
Added SWG Run Time Chart to make it easier to see different run times/SWG %
Added entry for Run Time hours so it will calculate % of SWG (opposite calculation of the Beta 1.0 calc). Both are included.
Reworked some formulas for easy of calculations
TFP Member "BestJoeyEver" made some suggestions to add calculation of SWG % based on hours of run time
Updated SWG Run Time Chart to have increments by 5% vs 10%
4. Use the SWG Run Time Chart to determine the Output % & Pump Run Time based on the FC PPM Demand
Split up Input sections to reduce possible confusion
Updated header / footer and print settings
Conditional formating to show good, ok, and bad values for percent table, adjustable in Setup tab
Add sliders for Calculate Runtime and Calculate SWG % input cells
Bold Column in SWG % table based on the FC demand ppm cell
Use ceiling function to round the SWG% in the Calculate SWG %
1. Enter your Pool Volume in gallons in cell D6
2. Enter your Average 24 Hr FC Demand in cell D7
3. Enter the production of your SWG in lbs in cell D8. See link for this value.
4. Enter a SWG Output % in cell D14. Use this % and the Hours output to set your SWG & Pump Run Time.
4. Enter a Desired Run Time in cell D23. Use these hours and the Output % to set your SWG & Pump Run Time.
Max Acceptable (Green): Enter the highest runtime you'd consider to be acceptable. IE: 10 means you want all hours below 10 to be acceptable
Max Possible (Red): Maximum physically possible time to be able to run your pump in a 24 hour period. IE: 24 since you can't physically run it more than 24 hours in a day.
Renamed "Min Runtime" to "Max Acceptable" and Max Runtime to Max Possible (24)
SWG % increments: Set this to whatever percentage increments your SWG allows. Most allow adjustment by 5% increments, although some allow 1% and some only 10%.
Added setting for SWG % increments, only effects "Calculate SWG %" in bottom left
Added link for Recommended Pool Levels by Surface Type
